page.title: 02ST.NICHOLAS CHURCH, WITHAM.
page.content: St. Nicholas Church is 600 years old and is made of flint and small stones.The corners are stone. There are Roman bricks in the tower which can be seen miles away.There are eight bells that were put in between 1601 and 1932.The oldest memorials have been lost but there is a parish chest with three locks.It looks like a pirates chest. There is a tomb with effigies of a Tudor judge and his wife (Judge Southcote).In the churchyard are two gravestones with skulls and crossbones on them. In Summer they have a Medieval Fayre to raise monay to repair the church. Lots of people dress up and they have dancing,mummers plays, and people playing old instruments. There are lots of stalls in the church yard and on the green. It is a lot of fun.
